verbose_text: Many studies have shown that the activity of N metabolism enzymes were significantly reduced under drought, salt, and heavy metal stress [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], Liu et al. [XREF_BIBR] suggested that GS and GDH activities increased in response to N addition under low-temperature stress; Zhang et al. [XREF_BIBR] suggested that NR, GS, and GDH activities were gradually reduced by nitrate stress, thus inhibiting N metabolism in cucumbers.
evidence: GS, and GDH activities were gradually reduced by nitrate stress, thus inhibiting N metabolism
